attributes.action: To safeguard our climate, wildlife and wellbeing outlaw felling of mature trees.
attributes.additional_details:
References

Rate of carbon accumulation increases continuously with tree size,  N. L. Stephenson, A.J. Dash, M. L. Zavala,  Nature 507, 90-93 (06 March 3014)

Why are trees so important? The Royal Parks website https://www.royalparks.org.uk

Neighbourhood Greenpeace and health in a large urban centre, O Kardan, P Gozdyra,  B Misic, et al
Scientific Reports 5  article number : 11610 (2015)
attributes.background:
Introduce a presumption against felling any mature tree. 
Large trees grow faster and absorb CO2 faster than young trees. 
They host insects, birds and small mammals; their canopies reduce wind speeds, trap dust, absorb pollutants and cool air.
Trees help people's mental and physical health.
